description: Venezuela vowed to respond “proportionally” to Guyana’s “gross violations” after President Irfaan Ali insisted that the country’s legal borders were settled in 1899 and include the territory known as the Essequibo.
title: Venezuela Vows Response to Guyana Border Claim in Latest Threat

description: Senator Elizabeth Warren called for a new restriction on major cloud providers Microsoft Corp., Amazon.com Inc. and Alphabet Inc., barring them from developing some of the most promising artificial intelligence technologies.
title: Warren Calls for New Limits on Big Tech’s Push into AI

description: The reputed star witness at the misconduct hearing of Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis faltered when testifying about when her romance started with the special prosecutor leading the case against Donald Trump.
title: ‘Star Witness’ in Fani Willis Misconduct Case Falters on Stand

description: The United Nations warned that one in four people in the Gaza Strip are “one step away” from experiencing famine, a situation it says will further worsen as humanitarian agencies report trouble delivering aid into the war-torn area.
title: One in Four Gazans Are Now ‘One Step Away’ From Famine, UN Says

description: On this episode of In the City, we hear how “financial engineering” could satisfy European legal concerns over seizing Russian assets.
title: Why Putin Won’t Get His $300 Billion Back

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Erik Wasson outlines where things stand on averting a government shutdown. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Government Shutdown Risks Diminish With Spending Deal in Works

description: The US has struck 230 targets in Yemen following Houthi-led attacks against shipping in the Red Sea, a top Pentagon official said, offering the most detailed public accounting of the airstrikes so far.
title: US Has Hit 230 Targets in Yemen in Response to Red Sea Attacks

description: A Chinese chipmaker was cleared of economic espionage and other criminal charges in a setback for a US Justice Department crackdown on intellectual property theft by China.
title: Chinese Chipmaker Cleared in US Criminal Trade Secrets Case

description: In a year when more than 50 countries are holding national elections, a new study shows the risks posed by the rise of artificial intelligence chatbots in disseminating false, misleading or harmful information to voters.
title: AI Chatbots Not Ready for Election Prime Time, Study Shows

description: Political, religious and civic leaders in Senegal proposed that the country hold presidential elections in June, a recommendation that aims at ending weeks of instability in the West African nation.
title: Senegalese Leaders Propose June 2 Election Date

description: Members of Congress urged the US Transportation Security Administration to quickly identify and close any security risks posed by public charter carriers that let passengers skip crowded airports and long security lines.
title: US Lawmakers Urge TSA to Close Public Charter ‘Vulnerabilities’

description: New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy is proposing charging the state’s biggest businesses to support its struggling public transportation system.
title: NJ Governor Pitches Higher Tax on Businesses to Help Transit

description: Armenia and Azerbaijan officials will hold talks in Berlin this week aimed at finding a solution to their conflict over the territory of Nagorno-Karabakh.
title: Armenia, Azerbaijan to Hold Peace Talks in Berlin Wednesday

description: Sensitive personal data related to health, location or web browsing history should be “off limits” for training artificial intelligence models, US Federal Trade Commission Chair Lina Khan said Tuesday.
title: Health, Location Data Should Be ‘Off Limits’ for AI, FTC Chair Says

description: President Joe Biden pressed congressional leaders to avoid a partial government shutdown, as they gathered at the White House with time running out to reach a deal.
title: Biden Warns Congress That Government Shutdown Would Damage US Economy

description: India arrived at meetings of the World Trade Organization defending agricultural and fishing assistance that the most populous nation provides to ensure food security and jobs, setting the stage for a contentious second half of a four-day negotiating forum.
title: India Defends Agricultural, Fishing Subsidies That Rich Nations Want Curbed

description: Growing opposition to President Javier Milei’s presidential decree in the Senate puts it at risk of being overturned as regular sessions get underway next week, jeopardizing his initial dose of economic shock therapy.
title: Milei’s December Decree Teeters as Argentina Provinces Resist

description: Poland’s premier admonished his Slovak counterpart at a high-level meeting in Prague over his criticism of military aid to Ukraine, laying bare European divisions over the region’s backing for Kyiv.
title: Poland’s Tusk Scolds Slovak Leader Over Pro-Russian Rhetoric

description: Ghana’s outgoing president, Nana Akufo-Addo, is trying to close the chapter on the country’s debt crisis as his deputy and favored successor gears up to contest Dec. 7 elections.
title: Ghana’s Outgoing Leader Aims to Draw Line Under Debt Crisis
EU Lawmakers Warn ECB Risks Credibility If Inflation Isn’t Tamed

description: A Labour government would make the UK “a more competitive and open economy” with managed divergence from European Union rules, the poll-leading opposition party’s Shadow Business Secretary Jonathan Reynolds told a manufacturers’ trade body on Tuesday.
title: Reynolds Says Labour Would Make UK More Competitive Outside EU

description: European leaders rejected the prospect of sending combat troops to Ukraine, undercutting French President Emmanuel Macron’s promise to do whatever it takes to keep Russia from winning the war.
title: Macron’s Ambiguity on Ukraine Backfires as Allies Balk at Troops

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy arrived in Saudi Arabia for talks with Crown Prince Mohammed Bin Salman, one of the few world leaders to have met Vladimir Putin since Russia’s invasion in 2022.
title: Zelenskiy In Riyadh For Talks on Path to Ending Russia War

description: French shoppers will soon be seeing a lot fewer “vegetarian steaks” in their supermarket aisles.
title: If It’s Not Meat, Don’t Call it Steak, France Says

description: The UK needs a “huge increase” in its ammunition supplies after two years of military aid to help Ukraine fight off its Russian invaders depleted stocks, the head of Britain’s armed forces said.
title: UK Needs ‘Huge Increase’ in Ammunition, Armed Forces Chief Says

description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said banks will propose preferential lending to farmers as part of government efforts to defuse a crisis in the agriculture industry that has sparked weeks of protests.
title: French Banks to Offer Preferential Rates on Loans to Farmers

description: The co-chairman of Memorial, a Russian human rights group awarded the Nobel Peace Prize and banned by the Kremlin, was sentenced to 2 1/2 years in prison for criticizing President Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine.
title: Russia Imprisons Co-Chair of Nobel Prize-Winning Rights Group

description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen called on the world’s largest advanced economies to find a way to “unlock the value” of immobilized Russian assets to help bolster Ukraine’s defense against Russia’s invasion and for long-term reconstruction after the war.
title: Yellen Calls for Way to Use Frozen Russian Assets to Aid Ukraine

description: Katherine Tai, US trade representative, speaks during the SelectUSA Investment Summit in National Harbor, Maryland, US, on Wednesday, May 3, 2023. The summit is to establish new connections and opportunities to grow through investing in the US, according to the organizers. Photographer: Ting Shen/Bloomberg
title: Biden Trade Chief Arrives at WTO Optimistic on Overhauling the Trade Forum

description: Donald Trump dubbed himself the “King of Debt” when boasting about how his business empire survived hard times, but a pair of big trial court losses this year are putting that moniker to the test.
title: Trump’s $540 Million Court Fine Tests His ‘King of Debt’ Title

description: Climate change, currency depreciation and economic degradation have led to food insecurity in Zimbabwe that ranks on a par with several war-stricken nations, according to a senior World Food Programme official.
title: Food Insecurity in Zimbabwe Is on Par With War-Stricken Nations, Says WFP

description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa nominated Mandisa Maya as the country’s first female chief justice, two years after she was overlooked for the role.
title: South African President Nominates First Female Chief Justice

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Riding the Backlash Against Climate Policies

description: Leaders from Poland and the Czech Republic said they’re against sending troops to Ukraine, responding to an option discussed at an extraordinary summit in Paris.
title: Polish, Czech Leaders Against Sending Troops to Ukraine

description: A billionaire ally of Roman Abramovich and a Russian owner of a brand new superyacht lost their appeals challenging the UK’s sanctions regime, bolstering the government’s pursuit of Russian assets.
title: Russian Tycoons Lose UK Appeal to Unfreeze Private Jets and a Superyacht

description: The head of Europe’s rescue fund said that his institution is keeping an eye on commercial real estate, but doesn’t see a crisis for now.
title: Europe Real Estate Risk Hasn’t Materialized Spectacularly, ESM Chief Says

description: Turmoil in the Middle East poses a risk to President Joe Biden’s reelection bid, threatening to sap turnout among some of his key supporters — and possibly flip the race to Donald Trump.
title: Biden’s Stance on Israel-Hamas War Sows Reelection Risks

description: Microsoft Corp.’s Mistral AI investment is set to be analyzed by the European Union’s competition watchdog at the same time that its deep ties to OpenAI Inc come under regulatory scrutiny.
title: Microsoft’s Mistral AI Investment to Be Examined by EU Watchdog

description: Surging ESPO shipments outweigh the loss of Sokol cargoes last week
title: Russia’s Crude Exports Shrug Off Halt to Key Pacific Grade

description: China’s shortest-serving Foreign Minister Qin Gang has officially stepped down from the country’s top legislative body, months after he was removed from his position and hasn’t been seen in public since.
title: China’s Ousted Foreign Minister Qin Gang Steps Down as Lawmaker

description: Thailand’s attorney general has indicted a former police chief and seven others for helping Red Bull heir Vorayuth Yoovidhya evade criminal charges after a deadly hit-and-run in 2012.
title: Thailand Indicts Ex-Police Chief for Role in Red Bull Heir Case

description: Israel will seek help from countries including the United Arab Emirates to rebuild Gaza when the conflict against Hamas ends, an effort that may face resistance from regional powers in the absence of a breakthrough in establishing a Palestinian state.
title: Israel Is Counting on Middle East Neighbors to Help Rebuild Gaza

description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt may announce a new UK tax on vapes as part of his budget next week, a person familiar with the plans said.
title: Hunt Considers New UK Vaping Tax at Budget to Protect Children

description: South Africa’s environment department said the number of endangered rhinos illegally killed rose to the highest since 2019, reversing a 2022 decline, as poachers targeted the southeastern province of KwaZulu-Natal.
title: South Africa Says Rhino Poaching Back on The Rise

description: Giorgia Meloni’s right-wing coalition is set for a narrow defeat in regional elections on the island of Sardinia, the first big electoral blow it has suffered since she became Italy’s premier.
title: Meloni Set to Lose Sardinia Election in First Blow as Premier

description: North Korea has shipped containers that could hold millions of artillery shells to Russia, a top South Korean official said, allowing President Vladimir Putin to maintain his assault on Ukraine as Kyiv’s stocks of ammunition dwindle.
title: North Korea Speeds Up Pace of Secretive Weapons Shipments to Putin

description: President Joe Biden defended his mental fitness, pointing out his likely Republican challenger Donald Trump also gets things wrong.
title: Biden Jabs at Trump’s Mental Acuity in Sitdown With Seth Meyers

description: Cries for reform rang through the humid morning air as activists gathered to protest in the heart of Kuala Lumpur on Tuesday, in a test for Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim as he handles growing disillusionment among his key support base.
title: Malaysian Reform Group Protests in Test to Premier Anwar’s Agenda

description: US Central Command said its forces destroyed three seaborne drones, an airborne drone and two cruise missiles in Yemen that were being prepared for attacks in the Red Sea.
title: US Says It Destroys Two Houthi Missiles, Four Drones in Yemen

description: Former Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison used his final speech before the nation’s parliament to criticize China as his successor faces an increasingly challenging task of improving ties with Beijing.
title: Former Australia Prime Minister Morrison Warns of China Threat in Final Speech to Parliament

description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping will visit Serbia in 2024, according to the Balkan nation, as Beijing’s broader relationship with Europe frays over trade disputes and the war in Ukraine.
title: China’s Xi Chooses to Visit Serbia in 2024, Balkan Leader Says

description: The South Korean government is investigating the death of a woman that may be related to the walkout by more than 9,000 trainee doctors, which has led to people being turned away from emergency rooms and surgery cancellations.
title: South Korea Investigating Whether Woman’s Death Linked to Doctor Walkout

description: MIAMI (AP) — Emergency crews responded Monday after a letter containing an unidentified white powder was sent to the Florida home of Donald Trump Jr., the eldest son of former President and GOP front-runner Donald Trump.
title: Donald Trump Jr.'s Home Gets Letter With White Powder Inside

description: The strength of the US economy has been a key driver of global economic resilience, Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen plans to say Tuesday ahead of meetings with her counterparts from the world’s top economies.
title: Yellen Credits Bidenomics-Fueled US for Brighter Global Outlook

description: White House deputy press secretary Olivia Dalton, a longtime aide to President Joe Biden, is leaving her post for a role at Apple Inc., according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Longtime Biden Aide Dalton to Leave White House for Apple
